messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tokugawa Daisho
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Mike So great of you to recommend Bill Rannows  . I am glad to hear that you have bought some fine swords from him. I am about to buy swords from him and
messages.messageBody:
Hi Mike
So great of you to recommend Bill Rannows . I am glad to hear that you have bought some fine swords from him. I am about to buy swords from him and did not at all feel anything wrong in our correspondance, only that he seems good and straight as you describe him. But I have been cheeted awful before using the net, even though I had copy of passport and drivers license. I am also new in collecting and buying on the net. Therefore I am very carefully to ask peoble with the same interest whether a seller is trustfully or not. I am very anxious to learn what I can from others but do not like to spend money for a sword and then donÂ´t get it. I wish to be aware about who are the bad guys and who are the good ones. .

Hi Steve
Thankyou so much for the link. Will love to investigate all the beautyful photos further.

Appreciate your help
All the best
Allan
----- Original Message -----
From: Michael Vinehout
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, October 27, 2004 4:42 PM
Subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Tokugawa Daisho


Hi Allan, I know Bill Rannow and have bought several swords from him. He
mainly sells polished and papered swords. He is a good guy and a straight
shooter. I recommend him. I have not been disappointed in the swords I
have bought from him. Hope that helps, Mike


>From: "Allan Schrattenholz" <apschrattenholz@...>
>Reply-To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
>To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [nihontostudy] Tokugawa Daisho
>Date: Wed, 27 Oct 2004 13:41:42 -0000
>
>
>Hi all.
>I had the opportunity to buy this in the spring 2004 from 2 private
>collectors ( former ). I bought the Daisho set first and then the
>owner had seen it on the net and then provided the tanto for sale. I
>believe that it is great that all 3 pieces are together now. Maybe
>that they some day may come back to The Tokugawa Museum ? Have been
>looking at many websites and hae besides NihontoAntiques, as I
>received very good recommendation about, - thankyou, also seen www.
>artswords.com owned by Bill Rannow who have many fine things on his
>site, swords as well as fittings. Does anybody know him or have
>bought something from him. It looks very good to me?.
>Regarding the Tokugawa, I need a little help to translate the
>correct mei on the shoto which I translate as Kunifusa.
>Unfortunately I can not differ from Hawleys Kun 34 - 39. I have
>tried to take some good photos of the mei but have not succeeded yet
>and will return for help when I have some good photos.
>I learn a lot from all off you so please continue the lessons,
>thankyou.
>All the best
>Allan
>
>
>

messages.subject: Tokugawa Daisho
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all. I had the opportunity to buy this in the spring 2004 from 2 private collectors ( former ). I bought the Daisho set first and then the owner had seen it
messages.messageBody:
Hi all.
I had the opportunity to buy this in the spring 2004 from 2 private
collectors ( former ). I bought the Daisho set first and then the
owner had seen it on the net and then provided the tanto for sale. I
believe that it is great that all 3 pieces are together now. Maybe
that they some day may come back to The Tokugawa Museum ? Have been
looking at many websites and hae besides NihontoAntiques, as I
received very good recommendation about, - thankyou, also seen www.
artswords.com owned by Bill Rannow who have many fine things on his
site, swords as well as fittings. Does anybody know him or have
bought something from him. It looks very good to me?.
Regarding the Tokugawa, I need a little help to translate the
correct mei on the shoto which I translate as Kunifusa.
Unfortunately I can not differ from Hawleys Kun 34 - 39. I have
tried to take some good photos of the mei but have not succeeded yet
and will return for help when I have some good photos.
I learn a lot from all off you so please continue the lessons,
thankyou.
All the best
Allan
